Package Services

Class EmployeeService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Services.EmployeeService
  • public class EmployeeService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service class for managing Employee (Cashier) operations. Provides methods to interact with the database and perform CRUD operations.

    • Constructor Summary

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(CashierListener listener)
        Adds a listener to be notified when cashier data changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be added.

      • isManager

        public BooleanWrapper isManager​(int pin)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                java.lang.Exception
        Checks if the given PIN corresponds to a manager's account. This method is useful for the login page to determine if the user is a manager.
        Parameters:
        pin - The PIN number to check.
        Returns:
        A BooleanWrapper object containing true if the PIN belongs to a manager, false otherwise. Returns null if no employee is found with the given PIN.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If there's an issue with the database connection or query.
        java.lang.Exception - If an unexpected error occurs during the process.

      • getAllCashiers

        public java.util.List<Cashier> getAllCashiers()
        Retrieves a list of all cashiers from the database.
        Returns:
        A list of all cashiers, or an empty list if an error occurs.

      • getCashierByID

        public Cashier getCashierByID​(int cashierID)
        Retrieves a cashier by their unique ID.
        Parameters:
        cashierID - The ID of the cashier.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Cashier object, or a default object if not found.

      • getCashierByName

        public Cashier getCashierByName​(java.lang.String firstName,
                                java.lang.String lastName)
        Retrieves a cashier by their first and last name.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The cashier's first name.
        lastName - The cashier's last name.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Cashier object, or a default object if not found.

      • getCashierByPin

        public Cashier getCashierByPin​(int pin)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException,
                               java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves a cashier by their unique PIN.
        Parameters:
        pin - The PIN of the cashier.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Cashier object, or null if not found.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs.
        java.lang.Exception - If an unexpected error occurs.

      • AddCashier

        public int AddCashier​(java.lang.String firstName,
                      java.lang.String lastName,
                      int pin,
                      boolean isManager)
        Adds a new cashier to the database.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The first name of the cashier.
        lastName - The last name of the cashier.
        pin - The unique PIN for the cashier.
        isManager - Whether the cashier has managerial status.
        Returns:
        1 if success, 0 if a cashier with the same PIN already exists, -1 if an error occurs.

      • UpdateCashier

        public int UpdateCashier​(int cashierId,
                         java.lang.String newFirstName,
                         java.lang.String newLastName,
                         int newPin,
                         boolean newIsManager)
        Updates the details of an existing cashier.
        Parameters:
        cashierId - The ID of the cashier to update.
        newFirstName - The new first name.
        newLastName - The new last name.
        newPin - The new PIN.
        newIsManager - The new managerial status.
        Returns:
        1 if successful, 0 if failed, -1 if an error occurs.

      • DeleteCashier

        public int DeleteCashier​(int cashierId)
        Deletes an existing cashier.
        Parameters:
        cashierId - The ID of the cashier to delete.
        Returns:
        1 if successful, 0 if failed.
